params.dst: The context (contract) in which the check is performed.
params.sig: The signature of the permission which is checked against.
params.src: The address that is being checked.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the check is performed.
params._sig: The signature of the function which is being against.
params._src: The address that is being checked.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the permission is revoked.
params._sig: The signature of the permission that is revoked.
params._src: The address that has permission revoked.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the permission is revoked.
params._sig: The signature of the permission that is revoked.
params._src: The address that has permission revoked.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).details: The check is based on calling `canCall` on the Guard instance. The contract is allowed to call it's own internal methods. If no Guard instance is set, function returns false (as a failsafe).

params._sig: The function selector of the function being called.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).return: True, if the caller is authorized to make the call, false otherwise.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the permission is granted.
params._sig: The signature of the permission that is granted.
params._src: The address that is granted permission.

params._dst: The context (contract) in which the permission is granted.
params._sig: The signature of the permission that is granted.
params._src: The address that is granted permission.

params._guard: The address of the new Guard instance.

_isAuthorized(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Returns true if `src` is authorized to perofm `sig` in the `dst` contract, false otherwise.

canCall(address,address,bytes32).notice: Returns true if `src` can call the function with signture `sig` in the `dst` contract, false otherwise.

forbid(address,address,bytes32).notice: Revokes permission from `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract.

forbid(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Revokes permission from `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).notice: isAuthorized will return `true` if `_src` address can call the function with the `_sig` function selector in the current context (in this contract).

permit(address,address,bytes32).notice: Grants permission to `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract.

permit(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Grants permission to `src` to perform `sig` in the `dst` contract.

setGuard(address).notice: setGuard will set the new Guard instance. The caller must have permissions to call this function in the current Guard instance.
